name: df-srng
body: |- wceq(csr, cab(s0, wsbc(s1, cfv(cstf, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), co(cv(s0), crh, cfv(coppr, cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s1), ccnv(cv(s1)))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ *Ring = { s0 |[(*rf ` s0)/ s1](s1 ∈(s0[RingHom](oppR ` s0))∧ s1 = `' s1)}
comment: Define class of all star rings. A star ring is a ring with an involution (conjugation) function. Involution (unlike say the ring zero) is not unique and therefore must be added as a new component to the ring. For example, two possible involutions for complex numbers are the identity function and complex conjugation. Definition of involution in [Holland95] p. 204. (Contributed by NM, 22-Sep-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Oct-2015.)
